page.title: 05A Wolds Farm (continued)
page.content:
After milking the parlour is hosed down and the equipment is washed automatically.
After breakfast there are various routine jobs to be done. For example,scraping up the collecting yard, checking over the milking machine, mending fences etc. Occasionally representatives call and take up half an hour or so trying to sell something new. The tractors and machinery also have to be serviced and kept in good repair.
Three times during the summer we make silage for the cows to eat in winter. First of all this involves waiting for fine weather. The grass must be cut, picked up by machine and blown into trailers. (continued)
